lessons.title: Marketplace Mechanics
lessons.content:
NFT marketplaces operate on a simple but powerful dynamic: **bids** and **listings**.

**Bids (Buy Side):**
â€¢ Offers to buy below current floor price
â€¢ Can be placed on any NFT in a collection
â€¢ Expire after set duration (1-7 days)
â€¢ No fees if not filled
â€¢ Create buying pressure and support levels

**Listings (Sell Side):**
â€¢ NFTs offered for sale at specific prices
â€¢ Visible to all buyers
â€¢ Can be cancelled anytime
â€¢ Subject to marketplace fees (2-3%)
â€¢ Create selling pressure and resistance levels

**The Floor Price Dance:**
â€¢ Floor price = lowest active listing
â€¢ Bids below floor = potential support
â€¢ Listings above floor = potential resistance
â€¢ Market moves when bids meet listings

**Why Both Matter:**
â€¢ **Bids**: Show demand and create support
â€¢ **Listings**: Show supply and create resistance
â€¢ **Balance**: Determines price direction
â€¢ **Volume**: Indicates market activity

**Key Metrics to Watch:**
â€¢ Bid-to-listing ratio
â€¢ Floor price stability
â€¢ Volume of trades
â€¢ Number of active bids/listings

modules.title: Laddering 101
modules.description: How to set multiple bids or listings at key levels to increase fill rate and visibility.

lessons.title: What is Laddering?
lessons.content:
**Laddering** is a strategic approach to placing multiple bids or listings at different price levels to maximize your chances of success.

**Bid Laddering:**
â€¢ Place bids at 0.1 SOL intervals below floor
â€¢ Example: Floor at 2.0 SOL, bid at 1.9, 1.8, 1.7
â€¢ Increases chances of getting filled
â€¢ Creates multiple support levels
â€¢ Allows for price discovery

**Listing Laddering:**
â€¢ List NFTs at different price points
â€¢ Example: List at floor, +0.1, +0.2, +0.3
â€¢ Catches buyers at different price levels
â€¢ Maximizes profit potential
â€¢ Reduces risk of missing sales

**Strategic Benefits:**
â€¢ **Higher Fill Rate**: More chances to get filled
â€¢ **Price Discovery**: Find where market wants to trade
â€¢ **Risk Management**: Don't put all eggs in one basket
â€¢ **Market Making**: Provide liquidity to the market

**Pro Tips:**
â€¢ Start with small amounts to test the market
â€¢ Monitor which levels get filled most
â€¢ Adjust ladder spacing based on volatility
â€¢ Consider gas fees when placing multiple bids

lessons.title: Advanced Laddering Strategies
lessons.content:
**Tiered Laddering:**
â€¢ **Conservative Tier**: 5-10% below floor
â€¢ **Aggressive Tier**: 10-20% below floor
â€¢ **Opportunistic Tier**: 20%+ below floor
â€¢ Each tier serves different purposes

**Volume-Based Laddering:**
â€¢ **High Volume**: Tighter spacing (0.05 SOL)
â€¢ **Low Volume**: Wider spacing (0.2 SOL)
â€¢ **Volatile**: More tiers, wider range
â€¢ **Stable**: Fewer tiers, tighter range

**Time-Based Laddering:**
â€¢ **Short-term**: 1-3 day bids
â€¢ **Medium-term**: 3-7 day bids
â€¢ **Long-term**: 7+ day bids
â€¢ Match duration to your strategy

**Collection-Specific Laddering:**
â€¢ **Blue Chips**: Tighter spacing, higher amounts
â€¢ **Mid-tier**: Medium spacing, moderate amounts
â€¢ **Low-tier**: Wider spacing, smaller amounts
â€¢ **New Collections**: Very wide spacing

**Risk Management:**
â€¢ Never ladder more than you can afford
â€¢ Set maximum loss per collection
â€¢ Monitor market conditions
â€¢ Have exit strategies ready

modules.title: Undercut Logic
modules.description: How panic undercuts happen, and how to use them as sniper fuel.

lessons.title: Understanding Undercuts
lessons.content:
**Undercutting** is when someone lists an NFT below the current floor price, often triggering a cascade of panic selling.

**Why Undercuts Happen:**
â€¢ **Panic Selling**: Fear of missing out on profits
â€¢ **Liquidity Needs**: Need to sell quickly for cash
â€¢ **Market Manipulation**: Intentional price suppression
â€¢ **Ignorance**: Don't understand market dynamics
â€¢ **Competition**: Trying to sell before others

**The Undercut Cascade:**
1. **First Undercut**: Someone lists below floor
2. **Panic Response**: Others follow suit
3. **Floor Drop**: Price falls rapidly
4. **Bid Fills**: Smart money buys the dip
5. **Recovery**: Price stabilizes or rebounds

**Types of Undercuts:**
â€¢ **Accidental**: Didn't check current floor
â€¢ **Panic**: Fear-driven selling
â€¢ **Strategic**: Intentional price manipulation
â€¢ **Liquidity**: Need cash immediately
â€¢ **Competitive**: Race to the bottom

**How to Spot Undercuts:**
â€¢ Monitor listings feed
â€¢ Watch for sudden price drops
â€¢ Check bid wall activity
â€¢ Look for volume spikes
â€¢ Monitor social sentiment

lessons.title: Sniper Strategies
lessons.content:
**Sniper Tactics:**

**Preparation:**
â€¢ Have SOL ready in your wallet
â€¢ Know your target collections
â€¢ Set up quick buy tools
â€¢ Monitor market conditions
â€¢ Have a clear strategy

**Execution:**
â€¢ **Quick Buy**: Use 'Buy Now' for immediate purchase
â€¢ **Bid Snipe**: Place bids just above floor
â€¢ **Bulk Buy**: Buy multiple undercuts at once
â€¢ **Hold Strategy**: Wait for recovery
â€¢ **Flip Strategy**: Sell on rebound

**Risk Management:**
â€¢ Set maximum purchase amounts
â€¢ Don't chase every undercut
â€¢ Verify it's a real opportunity
â€¢ Have exit plans ready
â€¢ Don't FOMO into bad deals

**Advanced Techniques:**
â€¢ **Bid Wall Analysis**: Look for support levels
â€¢ **Volume Analysis**: High volume = real opportunity
â€¢ **Social Sentiment**: Check community reaction
â€¢ **Technical Analysis**: Use charts and indicators
â€¢ **Fundamental Analysis**: Assess collection value

**Pro Tips:**
â€¢ Focus on quality collections
â€¢ Don't try to catch every dip
â€¢ Build relationships with other traders
â€¢ Learn from each trade
â€¢ Keep detailed records

lessons.title: Identifying Meta Shifts
lessons.content:
**Meta Shifts** are sudden changes in market conditions that require quick adaptation.

**Types of Meta Shifts:**

**Hype Breaks:**
â€¢ Collection loses momentum
â€¢ Social media sentiment turns negative
â€¢ Volume drops significantly
â€¢ Floor price starts declining
â€¢ Community becomes inactive

**Gas Fee Spikes:**
â€¢ Network congestion increases
â€¢ Transaction costs become prohibitive
â€¢ Trading volume decreases
â€¢ Only high-value trades make sense
â€¢ Market activity slows

**Market Rotation:**
â€¢ Money flows to different collections
â€¢ New trends emerge
â€¢ Old favorites lose appeal
â€¢ Seasonal patterns emerge
â€¢ Sector rotation occurs

**Regulatory Changes:**
â€¢ New policies affect trading
â€¢ Tax implications change
â€¢ Legal uncertainty increases
â€¢ Market sentiment shifts
â€¢ Compliance requirements change

**How to Spot Shifts:**
â€¢ Monitor volume changes
â€¢ Watch social sentiment
â€¢ Track floor price movements
â€¢ Follow whale activity
â€¢ Read market news

lessons.title: Adapting to Market Changes
lessons.content:
**Precision Response Strategies:**

**During Hype Breaks:**
â€¢ **Immediate**: Reduce exposure to affected collections
â€¢ **Short-term**: Focus on stable blue chips
â€¢ **Medium-term**: Look for new opportunities
â€¢ **Long-term**: Reassess your strategy

**During Gas Spikes:**
â€¢ **High-Value Only**: Only trade expensive NFTs
â€¢ **Batch Transactions**: Combine multiple actions
â€¢ **Wait for Calm**: Avoid unnecessary trades
â€¢ **Use Layer 2**: Consider alternative networks

**During Market Rotation:**
â€¢ **Follow the Money**: Move to trending collections
â€¢ **Diversify**: Spread across multiple sectors
â€¢ **Stay Flexible**: Be ready to pivot quickly
â€¢ **Monitor Trends**: Watch for new opportunities

**Risk Management:**
â€¢ **Position Sizing**: Reduce exposure during uncertainty
â€¢ **Stop Losses**: Set clear exit points
â€¢ **Diversification**: Don't put all eggs in one basket
â€¢ **Liquidity**: Keep some SOL for opportunities

**Pro Tips:**
â€¢ Stay calm during volatility
â€¢ Have multiple strategies ready
â€¢ Learn from each shift
â€¢ Build a resilient portfolio
â€¢ Keep learning and adapting
